Name: Probe
Description: Basic worker unit. Can gather resources and warp in Protoss structures.**Can attack ground units**

Root.Tooltip: Orders selected units to move to the target area or follow the target unit. Moving units will not engage enemies.
Root.Name: Move

Root.Tooltip: Orders selected units to cancel all orders and stop moving.
Root.Name: Stop

Root.Tooltip: Orders selected units to stay where they are and attack enemies that are within range. Units will neither chase down enemies nor move to engage.
Root.Name: Hold Position

Root.Tooltip: Orders selected units to move to the target point, fighting nearby enemies along the way. Targeting a unit with the Attack command orders that it be attacked until it is destroyed.
Root.Name: Attack

Root.Tooltip: Orders selected units to patrol between their current position and the target area. Units will attack enemies and move to engage nearby enemies.
Root.Name: Patrol

Root.Tooltip: Orders Probe to gather resources from a selected Mineral Field or Vespene Geyser.
Root.Name: Gather

Root.Tooltip: Returns the carried resources to the nearest drop-off point.
Root.Name: Return Cargo

Root.Tooltip: Orders the unit to apply your currently selected spray to the terrain at the target location.
Root.Name: Spray

PBl1.Tooltip:
Primary structure. Can receive gathered resources. Can use the Chrono Boost ability.

Enables:
- Probes
PBl1.Name: Warp In Nexus

PBl1.Tooltip: Warped in over a Vespene Geyser to allow harvesting of vespene gas.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Assimilator

PBl1.Tooltip: Warped in over a Vespene Geyser to allow harvesting of vespene gas.
PBl1.Name: Orbital Assimilator

PBl1.Tooltip: This ability is locked by your Commander Prestige.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Photon Cannon

PBl1.Tooltip:
Provides supply.
Supply allows you to warp in more units.
Creates power for nearby structures.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Pylon

PBl1.Tooltip: Enables warp in of Protoss ground units.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Warp Gate

PBl1.Tooltip:
Contains weapon and armor upgrades for Protoss ground units and shield upgrades for all Protoss units and structures.

Enables:
- Photon Cannons from Probes
PBl1.Name: Warp In Forge

PBl1.Tooltip: Contains weapon and armor upgrades for Protoss air units.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Cybernetics Core

PBl1.Tooltip: Drops the current order without performing it, and allows you to select a different order.
PBl1.Name: Cancel

PBl1.Tooltip:
Primary defensive structure.**Can attack ground and air units**
Detector
PBl1.Name: Warp In Photon Cannon

PBl1.Tooltip:
Extremely powerful defensive structure. Has superior range and damage, but is very expensive and attacks slowly.

Can attack ground and air units.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Khaydarin Monolith

PBl1.Tooltip: This unit unlocks at Commander Level 3.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Khaydarin Monolith

PBl1.Tooltip: This ability is locked by your Commander Prestige.
PBl1.Name: Warp In Khaydarin Monolith

PBl1.Tooltip: Restores shields to nearby friendly units and structures.
PBl1.Name: Warp in Shield Battery

PBl2.Tooltip: Enables warp in of Protoss robotic units.
PBl2.Name: Warp In Warp Robotics Facility

PBl2.Tooltip: Vorazun's Nerazim forces do not make use of the Robotics Facility.
PBl2.Name: Robotics Facility Disabled

PBl2.Tooltip: Drops the current order without performing it, and allows you to select a different order.
PBl2.Name: Cancel

PBl2.Tooltip: Contains upgrades for Zealots, Stalkers, and Adepts.
PBl2.Name: Warp In Twilight Council

PBl2.Tooltip:
Contains upgrades for Observers.

Enables:
- Observers

History is of vital importance to the Protoss, as they believe that great events echo across space-time and serve as lessons for those wise enough to study them. Even during the Aeon of Strife, Protoss scribes recorded the wars and their heroes for future reference.

The Observatory is a modern refinement of the ancient scribe library, and it is here that the data gathered by the robot Observers is recorded and catalogued for study by future generations of Protoss.

Stargate support facility.

Enables:
- Arbiters

The mighty Arbiter warships, surrounded as they are in a permanent distortion field, are extremely difficult to safely teleport. The Tribunal serves as a warp anchor of sorts, strengthening local space-time so that the Arbiters may be brought through the Stargates.
